summary.raw:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.
summary.html:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.

values.message:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.

summary.raw:
Fixed bug - wrong device used to infer if the wait monitor acquisition
device supports events.

device supports events.

values.message:

summary.raw: Removed widget left in controls.ui from copying it from another plugin.
summary.html: Removed widget left in controls.ui from copying it from another plugin.

values.message: Removed widget left in controls.ui from copying it from another plugin.

summary.raw:
Do not depend on newer labscript_devices to see if wait done events are
supported, instead inspect a connection table property supports_wait_completed_events
of the wait monitor device. If not present, treat it as False. If the events
are not supported, then just skip over waits as if they last 0.1 seconds.
Display an icon as a warning in this case, with a tooltip explaining this.
Move GUI into a separate file now that there is more than a single widget.
summary.html:
Do not depend on newer labscript_devices to see if wait done events are
supported, instead inspect a connection table property supports_wait_completed_events
of the wait monitor device. If not present, treat it as False. If the events
are not supported, then just skip over waits as if they last 0.1 seconds.
Display an icon as a warning in this case, with a tooltip explaining this.
Move GUI into a separate file now that there is more than a single widget.

values.message:
Do not depend on newer labscript_devices to see if wait done events are
supported, instead inspect a connection table property supports_wait_completed_events
of the wait monitor device. If not present, treat it as False. If the events
are not supported, then just skip over waits as if they last 0.1 seconds.
Display an icon as a warning in this case, with a tooltip explaining this.
Move GUI into a separate file now that there is more than a single widget.

summary.raw:
Use the pre-specified time of a wait or marker when updating the bar at the
start of a marker or wait, rather than using time.time().

start of a marker or wait, rather than using time.time().

start of a marker or wait, rather than using time.time().

summary.raw:
* Added 'science_starting' and 'science_over' callbacks

* made plugin_setup_complete failure log an exception so that errors are
  visible before the fallback call signature is tried

* Added progress bar, presently does nothing except being enabled and disabled
  at the start and end of a shot
summary.html:
• Added 'science_starting' and 'science_over' callbacks

  • made plugin_setup_complete failure log an exception so that errors are
    visible before the fallback call signature is tried

  • Added progress bar, presently does nothing except being enabled and disabled
    at the start and end of a shot

values.message:
* Added 'science_starting' and 'science_over' callbacks

* made plugin_setup_complete failure log an exception so that errors are
  visible before the fallback call signature is tried

* Added progress bar, presently does nothing except being enabled and disabled
  at the start and end of a shot
